chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela M. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela M. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copies of money orders from Angela Brown to victim total $150.00  Restitution balance will be modified by this amount. PF
from Angela M Brown re: asking for an extension to pay restitution, enclosing a copy of a letter from the victim.

ADDRESS INFO for Angela M. Brown
Current: 205 E Olive St, Desloge, MO 63601 United States  (Effective: 04-17-2017)
Prior: 203 South Grant St, Desloge, MO 63601 United States
from VWC Erin Mulhollam re: restitution reimbursement information

02:21 Defendant Angela M. Brown in court with Attorney Liesl Nelson, defendant in custody.  Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich filed amended information as noted in the Waiver of Prelimnary Hearing proceeding.  Court previously reviewd with the defendant the plea questionnaire and waiver of rights.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 of the amended information--operating m.v. w/o owner's consent as PTAC.    Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 in the amended information.  Froelich and Atty Nelson address the court regarding sentencing.  Defendant addresses the court. Court orders defendant to time served, restitution in the amount of $500 with 1 year to pay.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 02:29

02:15 Defendant Angela M. Brown in court with attorney.  Defendant Angela M. Brown in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: understanding that defendant will waive pre-lim. Froelich: apology letter written to victim in this case, $500 restitution. Froelich files amended information.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

3:15 Defendant Angela M. Brown in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $500 cash bond. Nelson has no objection. Court goes over bond conditions with Def.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Warrant was signed by Judge Boles on March 29 2016
